definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: Yes, yesterday was the my pay-day; I pay you the payment today.
sentences.chinese: 是地，昨天是咋哒发薪日，俺今天付给你报酬。

sentences.english: Withdraw those amounts on payday, and put them in three separate envelopes.
sentences.chinese: 发薪日当天就将这些钱留出，分别装进三个信封里。

sentences.english: With no state salary, he earns money by his wits.
sentences.chinese: 国家不发薪水，他只好靠自己的小聪明赚钱。

sentences.english: He concluded to quit on pay day.
sentences.chinese: 他决定在发薪水这天辞职。

sentences.english: I don't want to last longer. It's not even pay-day.
sentences.chinese: 我不想更持久，这还没到发薪日呢。

sentences.english: Finally, many people end up habitually using payday loans much to their detriment.
sentences.chinese: 最后，许多人习惯性地用发薪日贷款来付款。

sentences.english: He's probably pawned it till next pay day.
sentences.chinese: 他也许把他当掉了，到下次发薪日再把它赎回来。

sentences.english: Well the gas tank was nearing empty and we still had almost two weeks to go until payday.
sentences.chinese: 油箱的油不多了，但还有将近两周才会发薪水。

sentences.english: Make Money Fast With Project Payday.
Toyota is freezing pay for its 4, 500-strong British workforce.
sentences.chinese: 丰田已经暂停给它在英国的超过4500名员工发薪。

sentences.english: Don't jump the gun because they usually start distributing paychecks on the 15th.
sentences.chinese: 不要太早去，因为他们通常十五号才开始发薪水。

sentences.english: We join in the paychecks of the day, eat a big meal treat yourself a little.
sentences.chinese: 在发薪水的日子我们聚在一起，吃一顿大餐慰劳自己。

sentences.english: What happens if payday falls on a bank holiday.
sentences.chinese: 发薪日如果碰上国定假日该怎么办？

sentences.english: Today, it was supposed to be payday.
sentences.chinese: 今天应该是发薪水的日子。

sentences.english: The masked me help up the clerk and made away with the payroll.
sentences.chinese: 这些带面具的人拦劫了那个职员，还把发薪薄带走了。

sentences.english: I've just enough money to last me till payday.
sentences.chinese: 我的钱刚好够维持到发薪日。

definition: to pay in advance/to get payment in advance
to receive a raise in salary
to get an advance on one's pay
piece rate wage/remuneration based on one's output/opposite: time rate wage 計時工資|计时工资[ji4 shi2 gong1 zi1]
